Class RightSidebar

java.lang.Object
com.project.ui.RightSidebar
@Component public class RightSidebar extends Object
The RightSidebar class represents the right sidebar panel of the application's user interface. It is a Spring-managed component that displays context-sensitive action buttons on the right side, based on the selection made in the left sidebar.

This class uses a JavaFX VBox to lay out its child nodes vertically. The sidebar's appearance is configured in its constructor, and its content is updated dynamically via the updateButtons(CustomLeftButton) method.

Annotations used:

  • @Component - Marks the class as a Spring component, making it eligible for component scanning and dependency injection.
  • @Getter (from Lombok) - Automatically generates getter methods for all fields, reducing boilerplate code.

  • Constructor Details

    • RightSidebar

      public RightSidebar()
      Constructs a new RightSidebar instance. Initializes the VBox with spacing and styling to prepare the sidebar for displaying buttons.

  • Method Details

    • updateButtons

      public void updateButtons(CustomLeftButton<?,?> activeButton)
      Updates the buttons displayed on the right sidebar based on the active button selected in the left sidebar. The method clears any existing buttons and adds a new set corresponding to the text of the provided active button.

      The following cases are handled:

      • "Miasta": Adds buttons for adding and deleting a city.
      • "Hotele": Adds buttons for adding and deleting a hotel.
      • "Typy wycieczek": Adds buttons for adding and deleting a tour type, displaying tour prices, and showing tour cities.
      • "Wycieczki": Adds buttons for adding and deleting a tour.
      • "Pokoje": Adds buttons for adding a room, deleting a room, adding and deleting a hotel list, and displaying the hotel list.
      • "Klienci": Adds buttons for adding and deleting a client.
      Parameters:
      activeButton - the active button from the left sidebar that determines which set of buttons to display
